dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK STEVENS, thirty-six, is Middle America personified. blends in at the crowded ballpark. Blue jeans, work boots ball cap and leather jacket complete his attire. He snack a bag of popcorn. The CRACK of the bat and the CROWD is o their feet. A BALL PLAYER slides safely into second with double. JOHN SILVERSTEIN, thirty-three, business clad, ta on his cell phone. Calm and collected he appears unaffect by the cheering crowd. The sits with the crowd.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Helluva talent, that kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John flashes a quick grin, never missing a beat in his ph call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Probably be in the bigs in another year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John nods, smiles and turns away from Rick to continue uninterrupted.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MELANIE SIMMERS, twenty-four, scurries around a sparse, b neatly adorned house getting dressed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach? Are you ready? Mommy, can't be late again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZACH SIMMERS, six, sits on his bed in pajamas.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm ready.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on baby. Don't do this to mommy. Not today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to go. Melanie hastily dresses her son.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach, do you want mommy to get fired?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I get fired we won't have the money to go to Six Flags. Zach quickly dresses himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John still talks on his cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Must be something to have that kind of talent. He's just a kid, nineteen, twenty tops, and if he stays healthy and he stays focused, the world is his oyster. Guys like you and me, we squandered those opportunities long ago.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John ends his call and turns back to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guys like you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... squandered opportunities. I, on the other hand, knew where I was going. I had that kind of drive, I just never had the talent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You knew where you were going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Absolutely.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At nineteen?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Without question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The only thing I knew for certain was that I would run to the corner store every day for beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie pulls into a parking space and turns the car off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lock your door. I'll be right back. Melanie opens her door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie pops her head back in the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not thirteen. It's against the law to leave me alone in a car until I'm thirteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's phone RINGS. He ignores the call.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had priorities. I understood what it meant to have an attention span.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could focus?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was the King of Focus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Duke of Diligence?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Count of Concentration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is still looking at John when he hears the CRACK of bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick ducks. John appears perplexed. John's POV: A foul ba is screaming in his direction. Too late: The ball strikes John in the face knocking him out of his seat. Rick recov and continues to snack on his popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Polestar Prince.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie carries a soda and a bag of chips. Zach stands at cooler looking through the glass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you decide?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, Pepsi. (A beat) No, Seven-Up. Maybe root beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Make up your mind already.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So many choices. A glance to her watch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The game is over. Rick and John stand at the front gate. exiting CROWD flows around them. John holds an ice pack t the side of his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying grow up. You can't keep drifting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I did grow up...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When you got married?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You matured a little.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a process.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Bueller, it's a decision. One you need to make. You can't keep running without direction. If you don't know where you're going you'll never get what you want.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie and Zach stand at the counter. The CLERK rings th out. Zach grabs the bottle from the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want Sobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie snatches the bottle back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too bad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An impatient LINE OF CUSTOMERS waits.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want Coke. I want Sobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie puts the bottle back on the counter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To clerk.) We'll take the soda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach stomps his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two dollars and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hold on a minute. Please?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on lady.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Zach and Melanie exchange glares.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your Sobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The crowd has waned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought I got direction...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When Cindy had kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They gave you purpose. But purpose, my friend, is not direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My direction is east. I parked in the deck.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm right around the...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Corner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're always going in different directions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mine are much more productive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And much less adventurous.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I'm gonna...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I'm going to do. Responsibility calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John turns and heads south. Rick takes a bite of popcorn, looks to the sky for a moment, grins, and heads off Northeast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach takes a long swig of Sobe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sobe sucks. I want Coke.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John jogs up behind Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get a beer?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Gotta get home.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Family, my man. Take time off for a ballgame ya should probably tend to the family too. You should try it sometime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In the grand scheme of things family is a liability, not an asset. Rick continues on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling out.) Do you even know what you're doing or where you're going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yelling over his shoulder.) East.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: East leads nowhere, my friend. You should be heading south. The bar is south. East takes you places you don't want to go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick reaches the corner and darts across the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie stands in front of her BOSS (20's).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts. You're late.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the third time this week Mel. You put me in a rough spot here. My boss wants me to let you go. His boss wants me to let you go. I gotta let you go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If a person isn't responsible enough to be prompt to their job, they're not responsible enough to work for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're fired Mel. Just get your things and go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as Melanie turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We still on for dinner?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TWO OFFICERS parked on Main watch Rick cross the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think...?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Naw...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer's POV: A WANTED POSTER of Rick Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't tell from here...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too far away. Let's roost him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Call it in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick walks East on Buchtel as Police cruiser creeps behin

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer's POV: Slowly driving past, the officers recogniz Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him... get him, get him, get him. They curb the car in front of Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick appears dumbfounded as the officers exit the cruiser with guns drawn. Officer One remains stationary. Officer circles behind Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get em up. Up I said... up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get `em where we can see `em slimeball.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick raises his hands, dropping his popcorn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, we got ourselves a litterbug here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Placing his pistol back in his holster Officer Two grabs by the collar and throws him against the cruiser. Officer remains drawn on Rick. His hands shake with nervous anticipation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's going...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaddup!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Two cuffs Rick. Leaning in, he speaks in Rick's e

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know your rights, cretin, but just in case you don't...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What the hell? Officer Two spins Rick to face him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right to shut the hell up. Do you understand this right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer One appears very eager to discharge his weapon.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shut him the hell up, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you don't shut the hell up my partner might exercise his right to shoot you. Do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: `Yes' begins to form on Rick's lips. A quick glance at Officer One and he decides to nod.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's looking at me funny, Jimmy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right not to look at my partner in any way that might be construed as `funny' which could result in harm to your person. Do you understand this right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick nods again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He twitching?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really? I don't think he is. Are you twitching boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No Sir.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look at him, he's twitching. Nothing pisses me off more than twitching and talking. If he doesn't stop I'm gonna waste him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the right not to twitch or shiver or make any other odd movements that might encourage my partner to discharge his weapon, do you understand?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie grabs her stuff.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You never answered about tonight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're making a huge mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An unmarked car pulls on scene. The door opens. Low in on walking feet and pan up to reveal DETECTIVE JOHNSON, (50' a gruff man in tweed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do we got here boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's him. We got him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's a twitcher... a twitcher and a talker. Boy, I tell you, if he'd twitched one more time I would've deposited large amounts of hot lead in his ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll take it from here boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Report too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, that's your job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If we have to write the report I say I get to shoot him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one's getting shot today, Bobby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't I just wing him or something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Jimmy; get him out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Officer Two moves to his unwilling partner and helps him place his weapon in his holster. Officer One's hand is st clenched to his gun as Officer Two drags him around the c and forces him into the cruiser.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie drives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell me I'm not responsible... asshole. I have a kid. He has a goldfish. I have my dignity.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEL ANIE (cont'd) He has a brown ring on his collar. He's nothing more than a turd with feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is restless in the back seat. Johnson glances in the rear view mirror.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want to piss Bobby off. He's a little unstable.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A little? He represents your force?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affirmative action. We have to hire our fair share of disabled --- Quota thing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His psychosis doesn't appear disabling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MRS. NELSON, (60's), prepares a snack.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where's Zach?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Fired again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want to talk about it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The first thing I learned when I retired was that time management is an asset.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: FIVE diverse MEN, including Rick, stand against the wall. the other side of the mirror Detective Johnson sits with LADY IN BLACK (30's). A black veil streams from her hat covering her eyes, circa 1930's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take your time, Ma'am. We need you to be certain.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I see their profiles?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Detective Johnson keys a microphone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn to your left. The men follow their instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just... I just don't know...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Back to front.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three men turn to face forward. The other two turn to fac the wall.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All of you face forward. The two turn forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number three...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you have him step forward?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Detective keys his microphone again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Number three take two steps forward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick steps forward and the lights dim on the other four. Caught in the spotlight, Rick squints from the brightness The lady in black shifts in her seat. A long beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're positive?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm positive. That's the man that needs to be in custody.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The detective keys his microphone once again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay number three step back. Rick does as he's told.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Turn to your right --- all of you...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The group follows the detective's instruction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ...and exit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One by one the men filter through the door. Rick EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick ENTERS on stage. The entire theater is cast in shade gray. The stage is barren. There is no audience. He looks around for a moment and as he reaches center stage is onc again flooded with the spotlight. Rick uses his arm to sh his eyes. SFX: A SOFT DIN OF VOICES. Looking stage left R realizes TWELVE JURORS have appeared in their box. A smal AUDIENCE has congregated. SFX: THE DIN SWELLS TO A QUIET CHAOS. A RAPPING of a gavel and Rick's attention swings t white haired JUDGE (70's).

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order in the court.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The noise level wanes, but not completely. Another RAP of gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order in the court, I say.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Focused on the Judge, Rick doesn't notice THE PROSECUTOR approaching from stage right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrying a folding chair in one hand, notes and manila folders in the other, he sets the chair behind Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have a seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you know why you're here today, Mr. Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you being rhetorical?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you asking me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You stand here today an accused man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Accused? Accused of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have been placed in custody of your children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your children, Mr. Stevens. You do realize you have children, don't you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But nothing Mr. Stevens, either you have children or you don't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, you accept responsibility for bringing young life into the world?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I guess...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's no guessing, Mr. Stevens, either you're responsible for siring offspring or you aren't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am, but I'm not sure it was responsible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A crime of passion, Mr. Stevens? How convenient. (A beat) And you accept the consequences of said actions? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why am I here?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you here, Mr. Stevens? Why are you here? I'll tell you why you're here. Are you familiar with Ms. Cynthia Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, she's my wife.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Was your wife, Sir. Was your wife. She recently filed for divorce. Were you aware of that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, no I wasn't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, she did. She also named you as her coconspirator in the act of having children. Were you aware of that, Mr. Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Again, no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PROSECUTOR

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens, you just told the court that you aware you had children. You have also admitted that Ms. Cynthia Stevens was, in fact, your wife. (MOR E)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRO SECUT OR (cont'd) On top of that you told this court that you accepted the responsibility of having said children, did you not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then why, Mr. Stevens, do you continue to deny culpability in this situation?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick realizes the audience has swelled to nearly a full house. Beads of sweat form on his brow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Answer the question.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Like a trapped animal, Rick looks for his escape.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The question, Mr. Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can you be sure it was me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The audience hisses. The Judge RAPS his gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She picked you out of a lineup, Sir. What more do you need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Time is not an option, Mr. Stevens. Time --- is not --- an option.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A look of sad resignation crosses Rick's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't deny being married to Ms. Stevens, nor do you deny the act of procreation. You seem to understand that your actions bear consequence. You seem to understand that with parenthood, came responsibility.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PRO SECUT OR (cont'd) It seems to me, as it should to anyone with the capacity for simple deduction that you, Mr. Stevens, did willingly and knowingly enter into the commitments of parenthood fully aware of the potential pratfalls. Did you not?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, yes I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to pay the piper, Mr. Stevens. (To the Judge) It is the recommendation of the State that Richard C. Stevens been sentenced to the fullest capacity allowed by law.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Cindy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My ex, Cindy, what about her responsibilities to the children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Prosecutor moves to Rick and whispers in his ear.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She cut a deal, Rick. You were the one we wanted. You were the one we got. She took the plea. Sure, it costs her financially. But what is freedom worth?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CLAMOR begins to rise from the crowd as they talk among themselves. The RAP of the gavel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I see no reason to extend this any further. Mr. Stevens you have been found competent by the State and by this Court. You are completely cognizant of your surroundings, and you leave me no choice. This court finds you guilty as charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty of what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are hereby remanded to custody of your children for no less than a lifetime. This Court is adjourned.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A GASP in the audience mixed with CHEERS. Rick appears dumbfounded. A BAILIFF approaches Rick and begins to lead off stage. Rick scuffles and struggles. The Judge stands begins to collect his files.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do this alone. Don't make me do this alone. I'll never make it...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you can't do the time, Mr. Stevens, then don't do the crime.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mrs. Nelson ENTERS the kitchen carrying a book. She hands book to Melanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Highly Effective Strategies of Time Management for the Single Parent?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Learn it. Live it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It was written by a man... a married man.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Lots of single parents are married.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits alone, his head hung low. A JAILER, (40's) approaches leading THREE YOUNG CHILDREN to the cell. KRIS (8), is followed by PHILLIP, (6), and NICHOLAS, (4). The swings open. The children run to their father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you too, Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love YOU more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, how come you're in jail?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is this where we live?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: KRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we see mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come here guys. I want to talk to you. The boys gather round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PHILLIP

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know when we're going to see your mom again. KRIS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is she okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's kind of mad at daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: NICHOLAS

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy mad at me too?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, baby, not at all. Your mom needs time to work through some things. So, for awhile, it's just going to be us...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's she need time for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To figure out who she is, where she's going, what she wants.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I miss mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She misses you too, baby. And this isn't permanent... we're going to fight this... we're going to appeal. We'll take it to the Supreme Court if we have to.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't want us either?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course I want you. I just don't think I should have to do this alone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The jailer still lingers in the doorway, leaning against bars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel for you, I really do, but I've seen your kind before. You're a lifer. Whether it's fair or not. Whether justice was served. It doesn't matter. You're here for the duration.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys cling to their father. The CLANK of the door bei closed. The Jailer WHISTLES a sad spiritual as he walks a

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits on her couch and cries. Zach ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why are you crying? Did I do something wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing at all baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Pulling a book from an end table) Tell me a story?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The camera pulls back to reveal that the room is really a well furnished cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time, a very long time ago...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kids and toys are strewn across the floor. Rick wears a h shade of facial growth. He reads The Genealogy of Morals. Jailer stands at the cell door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get yourself cleaned up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have visitors... in the courtyard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Shaved and wearing sunglasses, Rick approaches his parent He reaches his FATHER, (60's), first.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quite the pickle you've got yourself in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So it seems.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's MOTHER gives him a big hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She was no good for you. I knew it from the start.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, don't... okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just saying...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know, but what's done is done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children notice their grandparents and run to greet t They tackle their grandfather's legs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's my boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandpa. Rick and his mother sit at a picnic table while boys play with their grandfather.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're dad and I are here for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you eating?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do you need anything? Food? Money?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch the kids one night? I could use some time to myself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... Yeah... okay... I suppose that would be all right... we'd have to ask your father, but I don't see why that would be a problem. (a beat) Other than that everything's okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're okay...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because it doesn't have to be like this. Mary Ryan, a friend of mine, her son had the same thing happen to him. Wife just up and left with no warning at all. He didn't waste a day. No sir, he was up and at `em almost instantly. You can leave here, you know? Mary Ryan's son did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I like it here, mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's to like? It's dingy and filthy. It's no place to raise children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's home and it's stable. The one thing the boys need right now is stability.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't keep hiding forever.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's been five days, mom. I'm not hiding. I just need time to adjust.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mary Ryan's son thinks you're hiding.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do I know this guy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's mother slides a business card across the picnic ta

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, but I think you should. I hate that woman. How can a mother abandon her kids? How could she do this to my babies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks to a blue sky.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU. on a wad of blue cotton candy. Pull back to reveal Ci and her new beau, SCOTT, (30's) and leather clad. Danger personified. Cindy walks, focused on her cotton candy. Sh doesn't realize that Scott has stopped to watch a HOTTIE past. The two exchange a flirtatious glance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Scott? Scott?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Catching up) Yeah baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I hope she's living in hell too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie looks through the want ads. Some jobs are already circled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What ya doing?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Looking for a job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know what you could do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could stay home with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you pay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach reaches deep in his pocket and pulls out a few coins counts them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sixty-five cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A week.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can afford that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If it keeps my mommy home with me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits across the desk from FRANK RYAN, (40): An uncou Italian man who seems content to stuff his face with a submarine sandwich and speak through his mastication.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, needless to say, I understand your situation. My old lady, she took off and left me with the kids five years ago. That bitch. But I'm not bitter or anything. I found me a good day care and moved on with my life. You should too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's hard...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Of course it's hard, sometimes feels like you're in prison, but you gotta be a man... stand up for yourself... provide for your family.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you can help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Me? I'll put ya to work. Some long hours, but it all pays off. Keeps you off the welfare system if ya know what I mean.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd rather pay you than pay the government to pay you. You can start Monday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Here's the number to the day-care. Tell them you know me, they'll cut you a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads 5:45 when Rick pulls into the day-care parking lot.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys follow MS. HEATH on the guided tour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And when school starts we have a bus service that will take the two oldest to and from school. We have story hour at Eleven, lunch at noon, and nap time at Twelve- thirty. Rest assured our programs are designed to be nurturing, caring environments that provide the parental guidance your children need in those hours you can't be with them. So, are there any questions?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you seemed to cover everything. Ms. Heath bends down to the kid's level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're going to like it here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids grab Rick's leg. Nicholas cries.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, daddy, don't leave us here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Heath looks up to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Reassuringly) They'll be just fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pushes a broom as the clock unwinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits in front of her FIRST INTERVIEWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry. It would be really nice to have you on board, but you're just a little too qualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are into everything. There appears to be absolutely no rules.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick eats his lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are engaged in a food fight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits in front of her SECOND INTERVIEWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too Qualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick fumbles with his keys as he unlocks his car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits in front of the THIRD INTERVIEWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Over qualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children run around in their underwear, Nicholas in diapers, as the PROVIDER launders their clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits in front of the FOURTH INTERVIEWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're just not qualified.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock reads 7:55 as Rick shuts off his car and opens door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits in front of the FIFTH INTERVIEWER.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've seen such a perfect candidate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The provider is hurriedly scrubbing the children's faces hands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: TRACKING BESIDE, Rick reaches the door and opens it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie leans forward in her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The children are crying.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are bad, bad children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick approaches the room. STEDICAM on Rick's face

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU. on Fifth Interviewer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Education level. Work experience. You really fit the billet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rick ENTERS the children run to him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, did everything go okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They were angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have fun boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys look to the provider who has a nasty scowl on he face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick loads the kids into the car.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys GIGGLE as they rough house in the back seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get those seat belts on. The kids reluctantly comply.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how was your day?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Didn't they feed you? They said they would feed you. The brochure said meals provided.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We didn't eat nuffin.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU. on Melanie. She appears relieved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Unfortunately we filled the position earlier today. WHIP PAN to cell doors slamming closed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pulls through the drive-thru, takes his order from a smiling EMPLOYEE, and doles out the grub the as he drives off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The kids aren't interested in eating. French-fries are fl everywhere.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands in a doorway. Frank fingers through a file cabinet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how was your first week?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirteen hours a day doesn't leave me much time for my kids, But a job's a job, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Now you're talking.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank finds Rick's check and smiles as he hands him his laurels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred and fifty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pretty good, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two-hundred-and-fifty-bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't spend it all in one place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I give you sixty-five hours of my time and you give me two hundred fifty bucks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's the American way. This country was founded on low paying, back breaking, long hour jobs. Why, work like this makes you a bona fide patriot. Ya gotta love it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mumbling as he EXITS) What's not to love?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ready to leave, the boys goof in the hallway. In the offi Rick waits patiently as Ms. Heath tallies up the weekly totals.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That will be two hundred seventy- five dollars and thirty-six cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a little short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick takes the money from his pocket and hands it to Ms. Heath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We take checks too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Checks?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Those things you use when you don't have money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm clueless. My wife handled the checks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does it help that I know Frank Ryan? He told me to mention his name.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Frank?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I work for him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Heath looks back to her books.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That changes everything.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Two hundred ninety-five dollars and thirty-six cents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank owes me money and one way or another, I will collect.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I'm forty-five dollars short...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And thirty-six cents. Don't worry about it. It's your first week. You didn't know, so, we'll let it ride and just add it to next week's balance. A beat as Rick turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know there is a way you could save quite a bit of money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potty train the toddler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ms. Heath pulls some literature from her desk drawer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Potty train? Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Handing Rick the pamphlet) The toddler.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits at a computer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mommy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, baby?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When are we going to have a normal life.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We do have a normal life... for us.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I mean when are we going to be like other people?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She pulls a flyer from the printer. CU. on flyer: BABY

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Nicholas sit on the cot. Rick reads to himself. Nicholas looks at the pictures.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big boy go potty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Are you a big boy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huge-mong-gus.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys are in the baby isle. Rick picks up a p of Pull-Ups studies it for a moment and throws it in the cart. On a community bulletin board he sees a flyer for b sitting. He pulls the flyer, folds it and stuffs it in hi pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sets Nicholas on the potty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Big boys go potty on the potty, Nicholas. Nicholas go potty on the potty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky shakes his head no.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're brothers go potty on the potty. Daddy goes potty on the potty. Nicholas go potty on the potty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky shakes his head again no again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy will buy Nicky a toy from the store.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If Nicky goes potty on the potty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky shakes his head no and begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want a toy!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys are in the toy isle. Nicholas has a hug grin on his face and a big toy in his hand. Rick takes th toy and tosses it in the cart.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky stands in front of his father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have to go potty?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits up abruptly.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Really?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is in Ms. Heath's office again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How's the potty training coming?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think we're making progress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hundred forty and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Seventy-two cents. Here's two- fifty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're still short.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know and I'm working on that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: May I remind you that we're not a charity? If you need credit go to a bank. I run a reputable business and I need the balance by next Wednesday, or maybe you should consider other arrangements.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip runs into the office crying. Blood streams down h head. Kris follows close behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, Kris and Nicky sit patiently. Rick's Mother and Fat BURST through the doors.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened? Where is he? Is he going to be okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He's going to be fine. They're working on him now. From what they told me it's just a few stitches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Boys will be boys. A NURSE peeks out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens can you come back? The doctor could use your help in calming the child down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Just go. I'll watch these two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip is in a halo. The DOCTOR appears perplexed as he stands near the child. Rick ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank God.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How can I help?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I need to give him a local so that I can sew the laceration, but he's not cooperating. Maybe hold his hand and distract him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick moves to Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi little buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to be a good boy, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, did you have fun today.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you play with all your friends?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh huh.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doc injects the child.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That fuckin' hurts!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But daddy, it does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's a big people word. You're a little people, and little people don't use big people words.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Doctor) I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The doctor offers a smug smile and begins to sew the cut.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do that again and my daddy's going to kick your ass.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip runs down the hall with a huge butterfly bandage his head. He stops to chat with all the NURSES. Rick walk few steps behind carrying his coat. The doctor hurries to catch up with Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look I'm really sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you something?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick shifts uncomfortably.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure, I guess.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My son's a wuss. He cries over hangnails. My wife and I have tried everything to toughen him up, but nothing works. I was wondering if our kids could play together. Maybe some of Phillip's "boy" would rub off on Junior.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands at the counter. The boys rough house with the grandparents in the background.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Insurance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, Insurance. That thing that covers medical emergencies?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I have any.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Everybody has insurance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I do.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The receptionist slides a bill across the desk. From Rick POV: the bill he holds shows a balance due of

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I run a tab?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You don't have a check?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick walks with his mother. The boys and their Grandfathe are a few steps ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm not even responsible for myself. How am I suppose to raise three kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It can be done.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't see how.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Find a way. Everything happens for a reason. God doesn't abandon his children, and neither will you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: God doesn't pay day-care.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There are other things out there... less expensive ways.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Could you watch them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh... uh... well... I don't think your father is willing to do that. We raised our kids, Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How `bout tonight, so I can catch a breath?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? My watching them while you were in there with Phillip wasn't enough? Make me feel guilty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll just ask God to watch them. He never abandons his children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's mom reaches in her purse and pulls some bills from wallet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't want your money mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take the money.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As Rick puts the money in his pocket he finds the flyer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky sits on the potty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Would you do it for a nickel?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick lifts the child from the toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Watch daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands in front of the toilet and relieves himself. Nicholas watches by his side. He finishes and zips himsel up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy go potty in the potty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I peed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's POV: A puddle on the floor. A RAP on the cell door Rick turns around to find MELANIE (24) looking in.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Melanie... The baby-sitter...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Oh, right, I'm glad you could...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My daddy has a big pee-pee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was just demonstrating the art of...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's okay. I saw.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Mumbling) Great.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie ENTERS the cell followed by Zach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a kid.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So do you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not criticizing, just surprised. I don't believe anyone at their old day-care had kids. If they did they kept them in a closet and only brought them out on special occasions. Christmas, Easter, an occasional birthday, and maybe when they had friends over for dinner, but only as a status symbol. It was like they'd say, "Here's the white picket fence. Here's the SUV. Here's the dog. Oh yes, here's the 2.5 children. Kids you can get back in the closet now."

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'd could make a fortune with a Renta- Kid business.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That has potential.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've often thought of renting mine. Why pay for a baby-sitter when thousands of people would pay good money to set your kid on the mantle for a few hours?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's his name?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm Zach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick drops to a knee and extends his hand.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hello Zach. I'm Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You got me there. I am old.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How old?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Older than dirt. When I was a kid we didn't have dirt. We had rocks and we had hammers. If we wanted dirt we banged a few rocks with really big hammers, and then we had dirt.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Worked the chain gangs?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're too old for my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris and Phillip who have been sitting in the corner real they have visitors and spring to greet them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is Kristian. This is Phillip, and the little guy from the potty, is Nicholas. Guys, this is Zach and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The four boys run OS to play.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beautiful kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thanks. So's your's.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ever try Cheerios?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For potty training. Give him something to aim at. Drop a Cheerio or two in the toilet and let him pee away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll have to try that. So, any questions about the job? Melanie moves towards the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to go talk to them for a little bit. I'll let you know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie crouches to the boy's level. They appear to take real shine to her. Nicholas hands her a book, and the fou them move to the cell cot. The boys gather round.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My mom tells great stories.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We don't have a mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's okay, I don't have a dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cot morphs into a sofa. The dingy cell morphs into a lit room. Rick watches from a doorway.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The end...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Read it again. Read it again. Read it again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm gonna talk to your dad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We'll read another one in a little bit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have a real knack there.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not a knack really. It's just about finding hope in places there should be none.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whatever it is, I've never seen them take to a woman like that. Melanie smiles.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want the job?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd like that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is pushing his broom when a gorgeous blond WOMAN wal past. They exchange long flirtatious looks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie is fixing the boys sandwiches.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the woman sit eating lunch.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're really funny... and kinda cute.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe we should...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go out sometime? I'd like that. When?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know... maybe...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tonight?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie on the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No problem.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys run to her as she hangs up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was your daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is he coming home?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, he's going to be late. He has a date.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They all snicker.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, I guess you have to deal with me a little while longer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie chases them in circles. They fall in a pile and wrestle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick picks at his food. The woman has barely touched her plate.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a single father? That's wonderful. So many men refuse to accept any responsibility for their kids. So, how many do you have?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... three.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's amazing. I'm sure they're just angels.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys jump on a bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick appears completely devoid of the conversation.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: My sister has three. She said when the second one was born it doubled the work. She didn't realize the third would double the work load would again. And to think you do it all by yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Um... kinda.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're a terrific man. Did I tell you I love kids? They love me. It just comes so instinctively even though I've never had kids myself. I get lots of practice with my nephews though. So, when can I meet your boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris stands with arms crossed and scowling. His posse of brothers does the same. Kris POV: Looking up at the Woman crouching down to him and smiling.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not my mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick motions for the check.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick flees on foot. The Woman gives chase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie tucks the boys into bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits with WOMAN 2.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A guy like you is so hard to find. I think I love you and I think you need to love me too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick jumps into his car, locking the doors behind him. Wo tugs at the door handle as he drives away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie pours two glasses of wine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and WOMAN 3 are engaged in a deep kiss. They fumble through the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie lights a candle on a table set for two.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and woman 3 tear off each other's clothes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie finishes eating alone and blows out the candle.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman 3 rests her head on Rick's shoulder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That was incredible.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know I haven't known you very long, but I there's something I need to say...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The woman, wrapped in sheets, runs down the street. Rick to the door and catches himself in the jamb.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling out) Was it something I said?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie washes the dishes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick drives home in silence.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie's asleep on the sofa. Rick kneels beside her. He lightly runs his fingers through her hair stirring her slumber.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you have a good time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, it was good... kinda okay... pretty much sucked.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What happened?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why can't I find a woman like you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're trying too hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I feel bad for the boys. They don't have a "mom". She'll always be their mother, but she'll never be their mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Quit trying so hard. You're forcing issues that can't be forced. Relax. Everything happens when and how it's suppose to. It's about spirit and finding the will to love again, for you and the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sits up and puts on her shoes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You want to stay and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm going to get...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Going?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You sure?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Positive.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat as they study each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I have to potty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll see you tomorrow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ok.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie EXITS. Rick turns to tend to Nicky. He stops for moment then heads to the kitchen for a handful of Cheerio

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is on his hands and knees wiping the floor around th toilet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicky almost do'd it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Almost, baby boy. Almost.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick walks against the flow of the CROWD. As if in a drea everywhere he looks he sees Melanie. Every woman has her face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The lights STROBE in rhythm to the music. Rick sits with and his wife CARRIE SILVERSTEIN.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Finally had to grow up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You've got direction.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose. I don't know if you'd call it direction, but there's a definite sense of purpose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Good for you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah, but is it good for the kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do the kids have direction?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris is in pushup position. Rick is dressed as a Gunnery Sargent.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Only two kinds of people make it in this world, boy; Those that are smart and those that are strong. If you don't want to be smart and do your homework then you can be strong and do pushups.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stirs to reality.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm probably not as demanding of them as I should be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have to instill a sense of direction at a very early age.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The entire family sits eating dinner. Rick's Mother looks Phillip.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, Phillip what do you want to be when you grow up?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip studies Rick for a moment. Rick nods an approval.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy says I can do three things when I grow up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And what are those? Phillip takes a deep breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can go to college and move the hell out of his house. I can join the military and move the hell out of his house, or I can get a job and...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... move the hell out of my house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick shakes his head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ya gotta let them be what they're going to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you have to mold them early. If you don't mold them they'll grow up to be Democrats.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you do this with your kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not the point, is it, Carrie?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think Rick is doing a wonderful job.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a struggle, going at it alone, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me, gentleman, I need to powder my nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie walks off.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whining about being single. Married men would kill to be in your situation!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm just saying it's hard.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have your sons to raise without feminine interference. Do you understand the significance of your situation? Do you understand the power in your circumstance?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys play baseball with an empty wrapping pa roll and a dirty sock.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick takes a swig of his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Men, all over the world, would kill for that kind of power.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys head out the door with fishing poles in tow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John isn't letting this soapbox go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You have the kids and she pays child support... and you sit here and whine about things being hard? Give me a break.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It does have its advantages, I suppose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys sit in front of the TV watching footbal Rick has a beer in his hand. The boys drink root beer fro beer mugs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John realizes the beer bottles are empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Another?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Uh...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sure.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John heads to the bar. Carrie approaches the table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He went to grab a couple beers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know Rick, someday some girl is going to realize what a good man you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Carrie, I don't even have the funds to buy my own beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Love isn't about money. Love is about truth and selflessness and discovering who you are and who'll be. Someday, someone will find you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie talks on the phone. Rick pulls her from her seat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'll call you back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie fumbles the phone. A beat as they look into each other's eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pulls her in for a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What was that for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For finding me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Melanie sleep in each other's arms. Nicholas sta at the bed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have to potty, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stirs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go potty, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas holds the box of Cheerios.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits straight up to the sound of Nicky's CRY and

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: An empty box of Cheerios on the floor and Nicky ankle dee water.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Frank sits at his desk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thank you for everything, but it's time to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going? What will you do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, Frank, but I'm worth more than this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick places his paycheck on Frank's desk and EXITS into t hall. The corridors ECHO as Rick walks away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You'll never make it without me!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is strutting his way into a new job. He's dressed we

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits at his new desk arranging a few personal. He le far back in his chair and clasps his hands behind his hea

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie, Rick and the boys fly a kite on a summer's day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie, Rick and the boys are eating pizza. Tears stream down Phillip's face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip, what's wrong?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, I wanted that piece and Kris took that piece, and I really, really wanted that piece.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's so important about that piece?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Zach grabs the pizza and stuffs it in his mouth. Phillip wails louder. Kris reaches for a pitcher of soda. A tussl ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Easy on the drinks guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Arriving home Rick grabs an envelope that is taped to the door. Kris bolts through the door and heads to the bathro Phillip is crying again.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong, Phillip?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick opens the envelope and pulls out a note.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I gotta pee and Kris...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not going to fight over the bathroom. (Calling out)

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RIC K (cont'd) Kris, your brother has to go too. Share!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris mopes back into the room. Phillip sticks his tongue at Kris. The boys EXIT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks up from his reading.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh? Oh, this? Nothing!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick balls the note and sticks it in his coat pocket.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip and Kris stand side by side over the toilet. A be as Phillip looks at his brother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This time mine's bigger.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris begins to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: STEDICAM on face as Rick ENTERS. Rick's POV: Cindy sits a table in the back. CU. on Rick as he approaches the table

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm really glad you could make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick seats himself at the visitor's window. Can't really discern who sits on which side. He picks up the phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I took off work to be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I want to see your boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think that's a good idea.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm their mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You forfeited that obligation, remember?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not fair!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You abandoned your kids!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did not. I left them in the care of their loving father. There's a difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just want to see the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think they even know who you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm their mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know things can never go back to the way they were before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rows of MEN are lined up outside the bedroom door. A MAN buttons his shirt and EXITS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Next...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy lies in bed smoking a cigarette.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy appears impatient.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick? Rick? Rick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Let's keep the attorneys out of this and settle things like civil adults.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick watches Melanie and the boys play NINTENDO.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hi guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
