dialogues.text: Daddy! The boys run to their father. Melanie moves to Ric and gives him a kiss.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This is a surprise. Leave work to spend the day with us?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on guys. Someone is here to see you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick? (A beat) Rick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick leads the boys out the door. From Melanie's POV: Loo out a window as Rick loads the boys into their mother's c

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy closes the car door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thank you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Three hours.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's POV: He watches Cindy back out and leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie packs her things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Where are you going.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Anywhere you're not.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about the boys? What about me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm all about second chances, but not when I come in second place.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you talking about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Why was she here? What was that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's their mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mother? I've been more of a mother than she ever was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's their mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who willingly walked out of their lives.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's their mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You keep saying that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You think this is easy? You think raising these boys is something I want to do alone? Every day is like a prison sentence. Every thing I do, every decision I make is directly affected by the boundaries of my responsibility. I have three children, but I have no me. Everywhere I go people stare at me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dressed as dirty paupers, Rick and the boys hold tin cups to the PASSING BY.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick continues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They stare at me, and I know what they're thinking...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A PEDESTRIAN drops a coin in ricks coffer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You poor, poor man. You poor, poor children. How unfortunate to only have your father. How terrible it must be not to know your mother.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie finishes packing her suitcase.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What about Zach? How noble of you to be the only single parent in the world. How stoic you are... so concerned with the best interests of your children. Too bad. Their best interest is walking out the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie EXITS, SLAMMING the door behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Against a burning sky, Rick waits in the drive. Cindy arrives. Her hair is strewed. The boys pile out of the ca and gather round their mommy. She kneels to their level.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: When can we see you again?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is someday tomorrow?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Someday is someday, baby.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Give your Mom a hug, guys, then get in the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys hug their mom and then run to the door. A tear w in Cindy's eye.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought things had changed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I am who I am, Rick. I'm not cut out to be a mommy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have told you that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to give it a shot. Rick turns to walk away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's POV: Sees the boys looking out the door. Rick turn back around to Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: At whose expense? Huh, Cindy? At whose expense? Who's going to dry their tears tomorrow when they realize your never coming back? Who's going to rock them to sleep at night when they ask why mommy doesn't love them?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You are, and you wouldn't have it any other way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A furious PULL BACK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ZOOM to Cindy standing in front of a door marked SOLITARY She steps in. The door SLAMS behind her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is donned in crisp business attire. He and the boys at the breakfast table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is Mel coming today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know, buddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes Nicky?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love Mel.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She loves you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The clock unwinds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits on the sofa his remote control in hand. Unkempt has a rough growth on his face.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy... Daddy... Dad!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Yelling) Don't you yell! If you have something to say, come here and tell me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Dad?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip's in the closet

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick unlocks the closet door and lets Phillip out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What were you doing in there?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Being Daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who locked the door?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Wasn't me...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick on the sofa. The boys gathered at his feet. He has a heavy growth of facial hair. He shirt is unbuttoned. His shoes have been discarded. He stares blankly forward. The boys lay sleeping at his feet. One by one PEOPLE show up begin to remove the furnishings. An open door allows SERV PROVIDERS to ENTER and disconnect. First the gas, then th telephone. CLOSE UP on a running faucet that slows to a trickle, then a drip, then dry. Rick's Mother and Father ENTER. She sits by her unresponsive son. Father lingers a distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick?... Rick?... Rick?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She stuffs a few dollars in his pocket as the CABLE GUY s up. The reception on the TV turns to snow.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of my babies.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick never acknowledges her. She kisses him on the forehe and LEAVES.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Close in on a bed where Rick's parents lay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What are you giving him money for?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To help him through the hard times. He's a good father, just having a rough go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I've never met a good father that couldn't support his kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A MAN ENTERS to repossess the TV. PEOPLE continue to ENTE the house taking Rick's belongings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: CU. on Rick's mom.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You could watch the boys while he works.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm too old for that. The better side of life has passed me by. What if they fall? I don't hear like I used to. What if one of them was seriously hurt and I didn't hear their cry? I hate that the only thing I feel competent to do is give them money. I love my son and I love my grandbabies, but how would I live with myself if something happened to those children?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Slowly pulling up and away reveals another cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A REPRESENTATIVE from the electric company stands in fron Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sir, you're 3 months behind on your electric bill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick reaches in his pocket and pulls the funds his Mother given him. The Rep. takes the cash.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's a start, but not nearly enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The Rep. EXITS shutting off the lights behind him. The ST of a match, and a candle is lit. In the flicker of the fl Rick has a look of desperation. He holds a gun. Rick's PO Looking down on his sleeping children.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The HOWL of the wind and the candle is extinguished. A WA pierces the darkness and then a GUNSHOT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A BANG against the bars wakes Rick and the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always knew you were a lifer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits across the desk from an ADOPTION AGENT.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Because of their age it may take awhile. We'll start them out in foster care, but eventually they'll all be placed in loving, nurturing environments.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are loaded in a wagon and pulled away from Rick an unrecognizable COUPLE. A small, hand-painted, sign tha hangs from the back of the wagon reads: BON VOYAGE. From Rick's POV: The boys move further and further away. Kris tries to christen the wagon with plastic bottled water. F the boy's POV: Their waving father fades in the distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick snaps back from his daydream.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They'll be together though, right?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens, I wish I could make that promise, but the odds of an adoptive family willing to take them all is astronomical.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Come on guys we're out of here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I made a mistake.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick sits at the picnic table reading a book. The boys ar off playing. Kris falls. He grabs his knee and cries. Ric drops his book and runs to the child. GUARDS on duty pay attention. Rick reaches the child. The injury appears rat serious.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling out.) Can I get some help here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: His calls go unanswered.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A tear forms in his eyes. Months of frustration boil in h face. A CONVICT passing by kneels by Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can you help him?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What does he need?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He needs a father, not a book reading baby-sitter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In a hushed rage) I can't fucking do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The convict runs his hand over the child's leg and everyt appears healed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use your mind and your heart. It's different than it ever should have been... but different isn't wrong.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Use what you have. There is a vein of wealth inside you just waiting to be mined. Think differently than you have ever thought before. Worker harder than you ever thought you could. Love these children like they've never been loved before.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: How?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The answer lies within. Quit worrying about how these misguided events have torn your life apart. Quit dwelling on all of your misgivings. Look around you. You're not alone. But you, and you alone, will make the difference.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick notices his cell door is unlocked. He steps into the corridor. Rick's POV: Walking past cells he sees people h knows. His mother and father appear very old. Melanie is Mrs. Nelson's house. Zach clings to her leg. Carrie's ang John talks away his phone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys wait for their caseworker. A pregnant W and her TWELVE CHILDREN sit a few seats away. Her face an clothes are as dirty as her children's. Rick looks at his watch, and then at her, and then back to his watch. He sl the watch off his wrist and hands it to her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not worth a lot, maybe a few hundred bucks, but it might keep you in soap for a year.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CASEWORKER comes to Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens, I can see you now. Rick and the Pregnant Woman lock eyes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I ain't some charity case. I know what you think when you look at me. You think; Look at that poor, poor woman. Look at those poor, poor children. How unfortunate it must be that they only have a mother. How terrible it must be not to know their father.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I didn't mean it like that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No one ever does.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the woman continue their stare.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mr. Stevens? I can see you now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry, I'm going to have to reschedule.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Responsibility calls.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is reading from a large textbook and jotting in a notebook. He wears his glasses. His boys come to him. Tak a break from studying he lays his glasses on the table. T boys pile into his lap. Nicky holds a storybook.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Please daddy? Please? Rick opens the book so all can see.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Once upon a time...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cell once again transforms into a small suburban hous One by one, things lost, are replaced.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is eating pizza and looking through the want ads. A ads are already circled.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm hungry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas pulls his shirt up to reveal his stomach.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's very, very empty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick hands him what's left of his pizza. He takes a swig beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm thirsty.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick takes a long look at his beer.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get your coats on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're leaving guys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick has a cart full of groceries at the check out line. OLDER WOMAN stands behind him. The CLERK rings up a final total.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Thirty-two hundred and fifty-six dollars.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick looks dumb founded.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Think it's bad now? Wait til they're teenagers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick loads boxes of cereal, Kool-Aid, Spaghetti-O's, loav of bread and numerous other things into a trough. The boy dance in excitement.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and his mother walk along.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Mom, I have an idea, but I need your help.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's mom reaches in her purse.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put your checkbook away. What I need you can't buy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you need.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For you to believe in me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick, his parents and the boys pound a sign into the fron yard that reads: "MOW `EM AND GROW `EM LAWN CARE 555-1616

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cindy is pushing a grocery cart when Melanie and her new BOYFRIEND pass. Melanie stops in her tracks, turns around after a brief beat, approaches Cindy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Excuse me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's ex-wife?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And you are?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can I ask you a question? What is Phillip's favorite color?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Blue. His favorite color is blue. How many teeth has Kris lost?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know. Why?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Four. Two on top and two on bottom. He got a quarter for the first one, fifty cents for the next two and he parlayed the last into an even dollar. Nicholas cries at night because he thinks the house is filled with ghosts. Kiss him once on the forehead, once on the cheek and sing The Cradle Will Rock and he'll sleep the whole night through. Kris' favorite subject is math. He loves to read and write, but he doesn't do so well in social studies. He knows how to ride a bike. Why? Because I taught him. Phillip wants to learn but he's always afraid he'll fall. Nicky just likes to Flintstone his tricycle. Phillip's favorite cartoon is Tunenami.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEL ANIE (cont'd) He's afraid of the dark and cries himself to sleep at night saying his mommy doesn't love him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's your point?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm more their mom than you'll ever be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, why are you here with slick and not with "your" kids?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Things change.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah... yeah they do. Now if you'll excuse me I need to find the asparagus. (A beat) I couldn't do it, ya know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie turns back around.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I always thought I wanted to be a parent, and I was really good at being pregnant, but I sucked as a mom. I know that now. I don't have what it takes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I've ever felt as much pity for anyone as I do for you right now.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Take care of my boys... all of them.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys stand by the river looking up a huge embankment. There appears to be no permanent trail. Looki up, scattered PEOPLE sit at different levels on the climb

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Well, guys, I guess this is it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stretches out. The boys jog in place. Rick cracks hi neck. The boys crack their knuckles. In SLOW MOTION they begin their ascent, running wildly up the incline. Rick f flat on his face. The boys all trip over him, leaving the all in a pile. Rick bounces up and dusts himself off. The boys do the same and away they go.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys are on their hands and knees with hand trimmers snipping away at the lawn.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick caries the boys. Phillip is draped across his should Nicholas hangs around his neck. Kris clings to Rick's leg is dragged with each step. They pass a weary CLIMBER who taken a moment to catch his breath.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is using a push mower on this huge estate. Nicholas follows behind with a bubble mower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys are dragging Rick up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys are crowded onto the seat of a large commercial mower.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The boys' do a victory dance at the top of the hill, thei arms extended far above their heads. Kris stops for a mom and then tugs at his father's shirt. Rick tries to ignore child but then stops mid-dance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is it, Kris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris points up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Look daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is looking through college literature, insurance applications, and YMCA programs.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick holds a college pamphlet. Rick's POV: He looks at th pamphlet then up to see they aren't even close to the top They have just reached a plateau along the way.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Through a weary voice.) Yes we can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick wears his painter's pants. The boys are armed with a assortment of paintbrushes. Paint cans and ladders adorn room.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys continue their climb. The breaths are heavy, but they march steadily upward.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys, hand in hand, walk toward the church.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick stands back and looks at one finished wall. Kris mim his father, backing up to have a look for himself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Kris!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Too late, Kris has tripped over a can of paint. As he sit his butt a look of fear crosses his face, a tear forms in eye. Rick takes his paintbrush and dots Kris on the nose.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hey!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Phillip and Nicholas are quickly engaged in painting each other and a full-blown paint war ensues.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A CHOIR of voices sings.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie and her boyfriend sit in silence. A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What's wrong? What did I do?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not you, it's me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What then?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie looks her boyfriend square in the eyes, runs her down his cheek.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie EXITS the car and runs down the street.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and the boys stop to rest. Kris throws a rock while is looking away. Rick looks up to find Phillip picking up stone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Put the stone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No buts: Put the stone down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Off Screen SFX: A huge thud and someone rolling down the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I knew this was a hard climb, but...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A RESTING CLIMBER appears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long way up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yeah.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Long way down for that matter.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A beat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what's your point.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No point, just an observation. Drink?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The climber holds out a canteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: For the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy, I'm thirsty. Rick studies the climber for a moment.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go ahead.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The climber hands the boys the canteen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know, if you stop here, halfway between a long way up and a long way down you really haven't accomplished much, have you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We're not stopping. We're just resting.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's what I said, fourteen years ago. Rick looks toward the top.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do this.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you can.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A reinvigorated Rick hops to his feet.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: We can do this!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes we can!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is back on the stage. The audience is full.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is so important Mr. Stevens that you would burden this court with convening today?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I just needed clarification.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: On what, Mr. Stevens? On what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know if I have to, I can do this alone, but do I have to do this alone? A hushed MURMUR rises in the audience. The Judge RAPS his gavel on the bench.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Order in this court! A beat as things quiet down.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your inquiry, Mr. Stevens? Is it in the best interest of the children or in the best interest of you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: He doesn't know. He just doesn't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then this court sees no reason to amend the original verdict. The order stands.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Tell it to someone who cares, Mr. Stevens.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have. I have laid my heart out on the line time and time again, only to walk away empty handed. This love, this caring, this sharing of life, it's a sentence and my heart has been condemned. It doesn't matter who I've told, what's in my heart is never quite enough. The people I have cared for most have shunned me in life and in love. Unanswered phone calls... Unnoticed displays of affection... A rose that withers on the doorstep... No matter what I do, it's never enough. Just once, just one fucking time, I want to be enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Your only condemnation is self- pity. You have people that care all around you, but you're too blind to see them. If you don't pull yourself together soon, my friend, they soon will all be gone.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: In B&W SLO-MO: Rick stands watching his sons play. Th blows the leaves of a tree. The boys run further and furt out until they are out of sight. Rick calls out to them. Slowly, across the field, three young adults return. Rick now an old man, hunched over and aged with wrinkles. The three young men walk beside their elderly father, support him with each step.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick is holding flowers. The boys have an assortment of "instruments" to add a serenade. The music is a mishmash odd notes that could only be construed as music to a pare ear. Melanie stands on the front porch, her arms crossed.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm a proud man, sometimes foolish.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a long way to go before I could ever be the man you need me to be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And I got confused between what I should have done and what I thought was right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes you did.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I put you on a pedestal and then I knocked you down. It wasn't fair.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Life's not fair Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You were more a mother to my boys than they have ever known. You were more a woman to me than I have ever deserved.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're right.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're not going to make this easy, are you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cut the bullshit, Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick wraps his arms around Melanie and pulls her in for a hug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (In Mel's ear) I can live my life alone. I can raise my kids alone. I can walk this path alone. I'd much rather do it with you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grabbing him by the collar she's torn. Melanie shakes her head.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She turns to go inside.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Turning back around.) I won't.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I shouldn't have come here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No, you shouldn't have.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick turns to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You just don't get it do you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You're here for you, you selfish prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie lays in bed covering her ears.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Days go by when I lose me. There are nights when I lay in bed and I can hear Zach through the walls. He's crying out for me, and I lay there motionless, wishing I was anyone but me, anywhere but here, thinking that somewhere, sometime, there has to be room for me. But that someday never seems to come. You're dangerous. Loving you means I lose me. And I will never lose let that happen.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: MEL ANIE (VO) (cont'd) So, don't come knocking on my door, asking for my heart, if you don't have room for me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie ENTERS the house closing the door behind her. Ric tosses the flowers on the porch, turns and walks away. Th boys follow behind.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I could have looked sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can look sad too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But I look sadder.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I sad.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nicholas starts to cry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick falls flat on his face. He lays there motionless.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't quit, daddy.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick pounds the ground, pulls himself up, dusts himself o and with a determined look starts back up the hill.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Daddy doesn't quit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and John sit at the bar.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You love her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think so... I don't know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you think you're in love you are.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I suppose I am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your heart skip a beat when she walks by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She's my best friend... or was.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does your heart skip a beat when she walks by?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes. JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Do your palms sweat when you think about her?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Does she inspire you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With music and poetry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And is there passion?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: There's fire.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And have you ever told her this? RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: She knows.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Have you ever told her this?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: JOHN

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Don't you think you should?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: RICK

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It only confuses things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Loving your best friend confuses things? I can't think of a love more lucid. Rick stands to leave.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You know I'll never forgive you for this, don't you? You had the power and the dream at your fingertips and you're giving it all away.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: You didn't marry your best friend?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you had things all planned out.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Affairs of the heart and those of the mind are two different things.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's not too late, you know?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: With a shrug John drops to one knee in front of Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go Home, John. Go home and talk to your best friend the way you talk to me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick BURSTS through the front door. His mother appears aghast.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I need you to watch the boys.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But you're father...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Father ENTERS.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Woman, enough.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: But...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: No more excuses. It's time to live life and enjoy our grandkids. (To Rick) Go. The boys will be fine.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Can't we just give him money to pay for a baby-sitter?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick BOLTS out of the house.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie is working as a waitress. She's pouring coffee wh she sees Rick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To herself) Oh shit.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Whoa!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The cup has nearly reached the brim.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Sorry.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Pay attention, would ya?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick reaches her.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What do you want?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: To talk.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'm working.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I know.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie is at the next customer who early awaits a refill but she doesn't pour.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, where are the boys?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: They're at my parents.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What? Not going to use them to try to persuade me with guilt?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Is that what you thought?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I have a son of my own. I know when people are using their kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ma'am.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (To Customer 2) Excuse us for a moment okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I'd just like some coffee.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie walks off. Rick grabs a cup from a recently vacat table and sets it in front of the patron.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Calling out.) Excuse me, Miss?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What is your problem?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: What?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The coffee, it's cold.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick picks up the cup, pulls a lighter from his pocket an runs it several times under the mug.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Setting the cup back down.) Quit your bitching.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick moves to Melanie.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you came here.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I can't believe you're a waitress.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Beats chasing around after snot nosed brats all day.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I thought you liked my kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I was talking about you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie moves on. Rick gives chase. He catches her and sp her around spilling coffee all over the floor.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I deserved that.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, what do the kids need? A babysitter? A surrogate mom?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: This isn't about the kids.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Then what's it about?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's about me, the selfish prick.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: About you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear me out, okay?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: (Looking at her watch.) You have 15 seconds.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Okay, okay.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Ten.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie, there is a grace about you that reminds me how clumsy I am. There is an honesty about you that reminds me how deceitful I can be. There is a beauty in your eyes that reminds me how ugly I've become. There is a kindness in your voice that contradicts my coarseness. There is a glow around you that illuminates my dullness. There is spirit in you that challenges my laziness, but most of all, there is a woman in you, that sparks my desire, a desire to be graceful and honest and beautiful and kind. A desire to be better than I am or ever thought I could be.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Go on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I think my ten seconds are up.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Who's counting?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Miss... My coffee?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Melanie sets the coffee on a nearby table.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Get it yourself.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I don't think I heard you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If I give you my heart will you promise to treat it softly? Kiss it when it hurts? Put it in a box and know that it belongs to you?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: That's not what you said.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I said I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: As brutal as that can be?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you. I love you, I love you, I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I kind of like you too.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick comes to another plateau and finds Melanie waiting f him.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought you'd make it.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Been waiting long?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I never thought you'd find me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I had to find me first. I hope you plan on walking, cause I'm not sure I can carry you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, how do we do this? The two begin the ascent together.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: One step at a time?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Side by side?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Maybe you could carry me?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick jumps in Melanie's arms. They tumble to the ground u his weight.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick packs his things in boxes. A knock at the door and t room morphs back into the cell.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick turns around to see the jailer standing at the door.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Getting out of here, huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's time to move on.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: If you leave don't ever come back.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Not even on a visit. You're a very ugly man. I'd hate to explain to the other guards why you'd come to visit me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick's Mom and the boys are playing.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Yes, Kris?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Grandma I love you.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her more.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love her the whole universe.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: I love you all the whole universe plus one.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick and Melanie walk across the stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: So, this is where it all happened.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: It's funny, the tricks the mind can play on you... but the Judge, he sat right over there... and the jury sat right there... and the audience was filled with all these people who didn't really give a shit about me.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A bunch of innocent bystanders?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: And they all sat passing judgement on me, not knowing the situation, just staring over their schoolmarm spectacles and pointing their crooked fingers.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: All the world's a stage.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Always casting dispersions.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Rick walks off leaving Melanie at center stage. She looks around. The faint echo of a Judge's gavel can be heard in distance.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Guilty as charged.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Did you hear that?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Hear what?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Nothing... nothing at all.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: PAN reveals: Rick, Melanie, the boys, and John sit watchi ball game.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: The secret of life, Melanie, is to always pay attention...

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: A pregnant Carrie returns to her seat carrying a box of hotdogs and drinks.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: ... always be prepared for what's right around the corner. The CRACK of the bat.

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Duck!

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: Huh?

dialogues.speaker: Unknown
dialogues.text: John's POV: A foul ball is screaming in his direction.
